meanings.definition: To move or urge forward with a quick, energetic motion.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy was hoseying his horse to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent2: She was hoseying her little brother to finish his homework quickly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was hoseying up the tree to escape from the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: The wind was hoseying the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The coach was hoseying the players to give their best in the game.

meanings.sent1: The students were hoseying to catch the bus after school.

meanings.sent3: The ants were hoseying to gather food for their queen.

meanings.sent5: The chef was hoseying to finish cooking before the guests arrived.

meanings.definition: To encourage or push someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: She was hoseying her friend to try out for the school play.
